intro: Aconogonon divaricatum, commonly known as the variable aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its branched, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
